alert.note: Alert for Monona (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 7:39PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Monona, northern Burt and southeastern Thurston Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles east of Rosalie, or 20 miles northeast of West Point, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Macy around 745 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Decatur. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 115 and 120. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Iowa...and northeastern and east central Nebraska.
